Function Documentation

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t UserApiCancel ( UserApiRefT *  pRef,
uint32_t  uUserIndex 
)

Cancel all queries to the 1st party.

Parameters
*pRef- pointer to UserApiT module reference
uUserIndex- index of user associated with this request
Returns
int32_t - result of abort request; see UserApiPlatAbortRequests()
Version
05/10/2013 (mcorcoran) - First version

References UserApiRefT::pPostCallback, UserApiRefT::pUserCallback, UserApiRefT::pUserDataPost, and UserApiPlatAbortRequests().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t UserApiControl ( UserApiRefT *  pRef,
int32_t  iControl,
int32_t  iValue,
int32_t  iValue2,
void *  pValue 
)

Control behavior of module.

Parameters
*pRef- pointer to module state
iControl- status selector
iValue- control value
iValue2- control value
*pValue- control value
Returns
int32_t - Return 0 if successful. Otherwise a selector specific error
Note
iControl can be one of the following:
        'abrt' - Abort the current request associated with the user at index iValue
        'avsz' - (PS4 only) Set which avatar size will be retrieved. iValue = 's' for small, 'm' for medium and 'l' for big. 's' is the default value, and this is just functional for PS4.
Version
05/10/2013 (mcorcoran) - First version

References UserApiRefT::aLookupUsers, UserApiRefT::bLookupUserAvailable, DirtyMemFree(), UserApiRefT::iLookupUserIndex, UserApiRefT::iLookupUsersLength, UserApiRefT::iMemGroup, UserApiUserContextT::iTotalErrors, UserApiUserContextT::iTotalReceived, UserApiUserContextT::iTotalRequested, NETCONN_MAXLOCALUSERS, NetPrintf, UserApiRefT::pMemGroupUserData, UserApiRefT::pUserCallback, UserApiRefT::pUserData, TRUE, USERAPI_MEMID, UserApiPlatAbortRequests(), UserApiPlatControl(), and UserApiRefT::UserContextList.

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t UserApiDestroy ( UserApiRefT *  pRef)

Starts shutting down module. Module will not accept new requests, and will abort ongoing ones. Also, registered UserApiCallbackT callback will not be called even if there is data available for processing.

Parameters
*pRef- pointer to UserApiT module reference
Returns
int32_t - 0 if successful. Otherwise -1
Version
05/10/2013 (mcorcoran) - First version

References UserApiRefT::bAvailableDataIndex, UserApiRefT::bAvailableDataIndexPresence, UserApiRefT::bAvailableDataIndexRichPresence, UserApiRefT::bAvailableDataIndexRMP, UserApiRefT::bShuttingDown, UserApiRefT::crit, FALSE, NETCONN_MAXLOCALUSERS, NetConnControl(), NetCritEnter(), NetCritLeave(), NetPrintf, and TRUE.

Referenced by UserApiCreate().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t UserApiPostRecentlyMetAsync ( UserApiRefT *  pRef,
uint32_t  uUserIndex,
DirtyUserT *  pPlayerMet,
UserApiPostCallbackT *  pCallback,
void *  pUserData 
)

Starts the process to post that a certain player was recently encountered.

Parameters
*pRef- pointer to UserApiT module reference
uUserIndex- Index used to specify which local user owns the request
*pPlayerMet- Pointer to the DityUserT to add to the recently met players list
*pCallback- Callback that is going to be called when responses for these requests are received
*pUserData- This pointer is going to be passed to the callback when it is called. This parameter can be NULL
Returns
int32_t - Return 0 if successful, -1 otherwise.
Version
06/16/2013 (amakoukji) - First version

References UserApiUserContextT::iTotalErrors, UserApiUserContextT::iTotalReceived, UserApiUserContextT::iTotalRequested, NETCONN_MAXLOCALUSERS, NetCritEnter(), NetCritLeave(), NetPrintf, UserApiRefT::postCrit, UserApiRefT::pPostCallback, UserApiRefT::pUserDataPost, UserApiPlatRequestRecentlyMet(), and UserApiRefT::UserRmpList.

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t UserApiRequestPresenceAsync ( UserApiRefT *  pRef,
uint32_t  uUserIndex,
DirtyUserT *  pLookupUser,
UserApiCallbackT *  pCallback,
uint32_t  uUserDataMask,
void *  pUserData 
)

Starts the process to retrieve profile information of players. pLookupUser is a pointer to DirtyUserT.

Parameters
*pRef- pointer to UserApiT module reference
uUserIndex- Index used to specify which local user owns the request
*pLookupUser- Pointer to DityUserT
*pCallback- Callback that is going to be called when responses for these requests are received
uUserDataMask- A mask value defining which elements are needed; USERAPI_MASK_*
*pUserData- This pointer is going to be passed to the callback when it is called. This parameter can be NULL
Returns
int32_t - Return 0 if successful, -1 otherwise.
Version
09/12/2013 (amakoukji) - First version

References UserApiRefT::crit, UserApiUserContextT::iTotalErrors, UserApiUserContextT::iTotalReceived, UserApiUserContextT::iTotalRequested, NetCritEnter(), NetCritLeave(), NetPrintf, UserApiRefT::pPostCallback, UserApiRefT::pUserCallback, UserApiRefT::pUserData, USERAPI_MASK_PRESENCE, USERAPI_MASK_PROFILE, USERAPI_MASK_RICH_PRESENCE, UserApiPlatRequestPresence(), UserApiPlatRequestProfile(), UserApiPlatRequestRichPresence(), UserApiRefT::UserContextList, UserApiRefT::UserPresenceList, UserApiRefT::UserRichPresenceList, and UserApiRefT::uUserDataMask.

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t UserApiRequestProfilesAsync ( UserApiRefT *  pRef,
uint32_t  uUserIndex,
DirtyUserT *  pLookupUsers,
int32_t  iLookupUsersLength,
UserApiCallbackT *  pCallback,
void *  pUserData 
)

Starts the process to retrieve user information of players. pLookupUsers is a pointer to the first DirtyUserT, and iLookupUsersLength is the number of DirtyUserTs.

Parameters
*pRef- pointer to UserApiT module reference
uUserIndex- Index used to specify which local user owns the request
*pLookupUsers- Pointer to first DityUserT in an array of iLookupUsersLength elements
iLookupUsersLength- Number of elements in the pLookupUsers array
*pCallback- Callback that is going to be called when responses for these requests are received
*pUserData- This pointer is going to be passed to the callback when it is called. This parameter can be NULL
Returns
int32_t - Return 0 if successful, -1 otherwise.
Version
05/10/2013 (mcorcoran) - First version
09/12/2013 (amakoukji) - Second pass with presence

References UserApiRefT::crit, UserApiUserContextT::iTotalErrors, UserApiUserContextT::iTotalReceived, UserApiUserContextT::iTotalRequested, NetCritEnter(), NetCritLeave(), NetPrintf, UserApiRefT::pPostCallback, UserApiRefT::pUserCallback, UserApiRefT::pUserData, USERAPI_MASK_PROFILES, UserApiPlatRequestProfile(), UserApiRefT::UserContextList, UserApiRefT::UserPresenceList, and UserApiRefT::uUserDataMask.

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t UserApiRequestRichPresenceAsync ( UserApiRefT *  pRef,
uint32_t  uUserIndex,
DirtyUserT *  pLookupUser,
UserApiCallbackT *  pCallback,
uint32_t  uUserDataMask,
void *  pUserData 
)

Starts the process to retrieve rich presence information of players.

Parameters
*pRef- pointer to UserApiT module reference
uUserIndex- Index used to specify which local user owns the request
*pLookupUser- Pointer to DirtyUserT
*pCallback- Callback that is going to be called when responses for these requests are received
uUserDataMask- A mask value defining which elements are needed; USERAPI_MASK_*
*pUserData- This pointer is going to be passed to the callback when it is called. This parameter can be NULL
Returns
int32_t - Return 0 if successful, -1 otherwise.
Note
For PS4: strData contains GameStatus pData == NULL means delete the rich presence For XB1: strData contains the Rich Presence String as defined in your Service Config Workbook More complex rich presence requests for XB1 will need to be set through their API directly
Version
09/12/2013 (amakoukji) - First version

References UserApiRequestProfileAsync().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t UserApiStatus ( UserApiRefT *  pRef,
int32_t  iSelect,
void *  pBuf,
int32_t  iBufSize 
)

Get status information.

Parameters
*pRef- pointer to module state
iSelect- status selector
*pBuf- [out] storage for selector-specific output
iBufSize- size of output buffer
Returns
int32_t - Return 0 if successful. Otherwise a selector specific error
Note
There is currently nothing to query with this module. This is a placeholder for future implementations.
Version
05/10/2013 (mcorcoran) - First version

References NetPrintf.

DIRTYCODE_API void UserApiUpdate ( UserApiRefT *  pRef)

Update the internal state of the module, and call registered UserApiCallbackT callback if there are GamerCard/Profile responses available. This function should be called periodically.

Parameters
*pRef- pointer to UserApiT module reference
